comments.body: Job added to Upwork: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~01b7f90c720aa62a3c
Triggered auto assignment to @abekkala (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @shubham1206agra (`External`)

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync

# Proposal
## Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
A different report  is opened when we refresh while we have opened profile detail of group chat member

## What is the root cause of that problem?

the profile page route doesnt contain any info about the reportId therefore the opened report in the background is not the same 

## What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
we need to modify the url of the profile page to contain the url of the report: 
for example: 
this way the screenwrapper will get the reportid and then displays it 
`/r/reportId/participants/:id/profile/`

or we can add `reportId` as a param and modify the screener to look for this param and open it in the background

## Proposal  
   
### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
- Web - Chat- A different group chat appears when refreshing the page
### What is the root cause of that problem?
- When launching the app with the deeplink that does not contain reportID, we use the ```getLastAccessedReportID``` to get the report to display.
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7bd51eba84f6708409dfd6e6886bf968eff3358f/src/libs/Navigation/AppNavigator/ReportScreenIDSetter.js#L63-L72
- In the above, the ```findLastAccessedReport``` is not working properly. 
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7bd51eba84f6708409dfd6e6886bf968eff3358f/src/libs/ReportUtils.js#L575-L581
- ```findLastAccessedReport``` uses ```sortReportsByLastRead```:
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7bd51eba84f6708409dfd6e6886bf968eff3358f/src/libs/ReportUtils.js#L263-L269 that will sort the reports by "lastReadTime". This is incorrect because the "lastReadTime" refers to the latest time the user read a new message, not the latest time the user visits a report. For example, if we read a new message A on 3/10/2023, and re-visit its report on 4/10/2023, the "lastReadTime" is still '3/10/2023'.
### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
- Once we visit the report, we need to add the ```lastVisitTime: DateUtils.getDBTime()``` to the report or use ```ONYXKEYS.COLLECTION.REPORT_METADATA``` to store the above data. 

- Then, in the ```sortReportsByLastRead```, using ```lastVisitTime``` to sort the reports. We can do it by updating:
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7bd51eba84f6708409dfd6e6886bf968eff3358f/src/libs/ReportUtils.js#L263-L269
to:
````diff
function sortReportsByLastRead(reports) {
    return _.chain(reports)
+        .map((report) => {
+           const lastReadTime = lodashGet(report, 'lastVisitTime') || lodashGet(report, 'lastReadTime');
+             return {...report, lastReadTime};
        })
        .toArray()
        .filter((report) => report && report.reportID && report.lastReadTime)
        .sortBy('lastReadTime')
        .value();
}
````


### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
- NA
@FitseTLT Your proposal might not work with deleting reports. Do you have any workaround for this?

> @FitseTLT Your proposal might not work with deleting reports. Do you have any workaround for this?

Yes instead of saving a single reportID everytime a user opens a report we can save a stack of reportIDs and when opening the `reportIDSetter` will populate the recent opened available reportID to the `ReportScreen` and the case all IDs saved in their don't exist will default to the previous logic of `findLastAccessedReport` 👍  .
@shubham1206agra Updated [proposal](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/30868#issuecomment-1792965156)

Since @FitseTLT's solution will not be as strong as I thought. And @DylanDylann's [proposal](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/30868#issuecomment-1793304559) will cover more wide cases. I think we should go for @DylanDylann.

🎀 👀 🎀 C+ reviewed

cc @MonilBhavsar
Current assignee @MonilBhavsar is eligible for the choreEngineerContributorManagement assigner, not assigning anyone new.

@MonilBhavsar  @shubham1206agra Please take a look at this [solution](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/30778#issuecomment-1797934564) to this [issue](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/30778) they are using an approach that is similar to what I proposed and if they are going to implement it, the updating of `lastVisitTime` approach you have chosen here will be redundant/ overlapping solution to that approach they are using to save a stack of recently opened reports in Onyx. 👍
Amending the issue body, @jliexpensify was the reporter of this issue

@DylanDylann I know that your solution solves both issues that's what I commented but @shubham1206agra the advantage of my proposal and the one [proposed](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/30778#issuecomment-1797934564) for the other issue is that it is efficient memory-wise to only save a few last accessed report Ids (maybe 5) instead of a `lastVisitTime` field for every single reports a user has. Please try to reconsider it and also communicate with the assignees of that issue 👍 Thanks.
cc @jliexpensify @MonilBhavsar
@FitseTLT Yeah, thanks. I`ve commented on the issue that you mentioned to discuss the expected solution.

So, I have discussed this with @MonilBhavsar. Given https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/30868#issuecomment-1802566373, we are going to put the issue on HOLD till that issue is resolved, and then we are simply going to use this.

So, I am going to take back my previous review.
Bumping to weekly as it is on HOLD

Taking this off hold as we discussed here https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C02NK2DQWUX/p1700121699237619?thread_ts=1698756003.834449&cid=C02NK2DQWUX

@DylanDylann Could you please share test branch so we can test the proposal. We're thinking to move forward with that solution to keep behavior same as of today and not over engineer it. Thanks!
@MonilBhavs Here is the draft PR https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31424 , please help check
Sorry for the delay. I will update here as soon as possible.

@DylanDylann Hi, how is the PR going? When can we expect it to be open for review? We have put this PR https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31097 on HOLD for the changes being added here. Let us know if you need any help in moving it forward.

@techievivek I`ve created the draft PR and request @shubham1206agra review https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/30868#issuecomment-1814077551
- Also, should we assign this issue to me?

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.3.94.0 **Reproducible in staging?:** y **Reproducible in production?:** y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @jliexpensify **Slack conversation:** https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1698904742009159 ## Action Performed: 1. Create a group conversation 2. Type something 3. Clicking on a profile 4. Refresh the page ## Expected Result: The same group chat appears when refreshing the page ## Actual Result: A different group chat appears when refreshing the page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: Native - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/93399543/8439bb82-91bd-4cd8-aecb-da7059063b20 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
